comments:
1.5RC0

I tried to connect to DB2 but got a couple of exceptions/error dialogs (one right after profile creation and another when trying to connect).

Error
Wed May 23 09:50:07 CEST 2007
An internal error occurred during: "Ping server job".

java.lang.NullPointerException
at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.internal.ConnectionProfile.createConnection(ConnectionProfile.java:352)
at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.ui.PingJob.run(PingJob.java:57)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

Hey Gunnar,

Could you see if this problem is reproduceable on Java5?  DTP does not support J6.

Thanks in advance,
Rob
Yes, it doesn't work with Sun JDK 1.50_10 either and if you look at the stack traces it doesn't seem to be a JDK problem.

Hey Gunnar,

This is what raised my concern about the JDK version:

java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException
at java.util.AbstractMap.put(Unknown Source)

This implies that the HashMap implementation is not overriding put().  Not sure what would cause this.

Anyway, this is the root of the problem.  The connection factory extension is not being loaded, which means you can't create a connection, hence the other exception.

Rob

(In reply to comment #3)
> This implies that the HashMap implementation is not overriding put().  Not sure
> what would cause this.

I had a similar problem in a different project. I haven't looked at the DTP source yet so this may be a dump question. Are you sure it's actually a HashMap and not some unmodifyable map? A simple "mymap = new HashMap(mymap);" should be sufficient then.

(In reply to comment #4)
> I had a similar problem in a different project. I haven't looked at the DTP
> source yet so this may be a dump question. Are you sure it's actually a HashMap
> and not some unmodifyable map? A simple "mymap = new HashMap(mymap);" should be
> sufficient then.

I think that is part of the problem.  If the plugin providing support for the profile is not installed, this would occur (map = Collections.EMPTY_MAP).

Based on that, I think there are two problems here:
1.  The object representing the connection profile provider does not behave correctly when it is acting as a place holder.
2.  The plugin providing support for the DB2 connection profile is not installed.  (If I were a betting man, I'd bet this profile shows up in "Unsupported" in the DSE.)

Does that sound plausible?

Rob

(In reply to comment #5)
> 2.  The plugin providing support for the DB2 connection profile is not
> installed.  (If I were a betting man, I'd bet this profile shows up in
> "Unsupported" in the DSE.)

Mhm. The enablement DB2 LUW plug-ins were included. Are there any other plug-ins required? I did not want to include the full enablement feature because I has some requirement on ODA Designer and Reporter.
This could be an install issue.  Forwarding to one of the IBMers as the problem is specific to DB2.
It works after updating to the new feature structure provided in DTP 1.5RC2

traces.message: The connection profile : CMS DB2 is not connected yet.
